Quote.Speaker: David Brent
Quote.Text: Oh, sorry, mate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [English accent] Oh, sorry, mate. Excuse me. Mate.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [laughing] What you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: English?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You picked on the wrong person, I can tell you that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh no no, I'm not picking on you at all. You're English, correct?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yeah big time, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm working on an English character. Would you mind gi... It's called Reginald Pooftah.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Ooh! David Brent, my liege. How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Oh, there you go. I do characters as well. I got a Chinese fella. He's called Ho Li [bleep]. That's what it sounds like.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Herrow! Herrow!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do Ping. Herrow. I Ping!

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You can't do that these days. You can't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. And people don't understand that is has nothing to do with making fun of a different nationality.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No, no. No, comedy is a place where the mind goes to tickle itself. That's what she said. [laughs]. [hugs Michaels] Ohh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's good. Pleasure to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Where are you working?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Any jobs now?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, not right now.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Just let me know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. See you around.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bye-bye. What a nice guy.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Your first student is here, Mister Bernard.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's actually "Master of Ceremonies" Bernard.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Last year, I went to a seminar called "The Ten Secrets of Real Estate". Turns out it was just a ploy to sell me time-shares in Idaho. Cut to, you know, spending a weekend in Boise, terrible time, super lonely. But I get to thinking maybe I should put on my own seminar to lure clients.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh it's... [points to conference room]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [enters] [in a gruff voice] Hello, I am here for the small business seminar.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nein! I'm greek! My name is Mikanos.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ooh. Wait, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am the plant. Every great seminar has one. My job is to make the speaker look good, and I do this through the techniques of leading questions and laughing at all jokes. And the character "Mikanos", is just a little added flava. "Mikanos" is loosely based on another character I do, "Spiros", who is more about the ladies.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you so much Tuna Turner. You are simply the best.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Listen, this isn't a favor, all right? This is a good idea. We all win.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Go higher. I get super flexible when I'm nervous.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. [sees guy at Erin's desk] Stop, stop, stop, stop, stop, stop. Hey, Andy, I'm really, really sorry to do this to you, but I have a meeting today that I totally forgot, so I can't be apart of this seminar.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. What? You can't do that. You are a critical part of this seminar. You're the charming warm-up guy,

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If the seminar was a meal, you'd be the amuse-bouche. You like, signal the flavors of the whole night.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm really sorry. I can't do it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You can't. You can't.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I can't have this go badly. I'm a terrible salesman, and I haven't been making very many sales lately, or ever. This is my only idea on how to turn things around. If it goes badly, I might lose my job, which would suck because this is the only job I've ever been good at.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Will you let me know when this whole seminar thing's over?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's going on? Do you know that guy?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just have a meeting, uh, outside the office.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Erin] How are the marks?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are some of your small business ideas?

Quote.Speaker: Older guy
Quote.Text: I was thinking we could buy up of abandoned mine shafts.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis, Stanley, Dwight
Quote.Text: Oooh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's great. There's a big, big future in that.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: A lot of mines in Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Um, what about you?

Quote.Speaker: Younger Guy
Quote.Text: Uh, credit cards.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Younger Guy
Quote.Text: My company would act as an intermedium, for like, point two cents off every transaction.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Younger Guy
Quote.Text: Something with cell phones. It's like, every time you make a phone call I'd make point two cents. Or anything like any on-line shopping I would get point two cents.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right. Okay? Great.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You promised us whales. These are worms.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: They're not worms, Dwight, okay? They're just people with tiny businesses. They're baby whales which is even cuter.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm out.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Stanley, you're suppose to close.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm out too.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What? I already lost Jim. Salesmen are suppose to help each other out. We're suppose to be a team.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We're no more a team than the people staying in the same hotel are a team.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what might be kind of fun? I was thinking , you know Andy is having a seminar today? What if we went in as a greek couple? Mikanos and...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't know, Michael. I'm not feeling up to that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Holly broke up with A.J last week, which is the greatest thing that has ever happened... to me. To Holly, it's been the worst week of her life, and I know for a fact that there was a week for her in high school when she got mono and her first period ever. Too much information? That's what I thought. But, you know what? Here I am using it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [as Mikanos] If-a you change-a you mind, why don't you talk to Mikanos?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Is Mikanos greek? He sounds Italian.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ugh. You're the fifth person to tell me that today.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Maybe Mikanos ran away to join the Italian circus.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, yeah, like a character history. Good. Tom Hanks does that.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [muttering] Down... there. [to Pam] Is "jlp" a word?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: "Jelp?" J-e-l-p?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No, j-l-p. Like, "I jlp... I jlp you!"

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think that's a word.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm playing Scrabble with Gabe, and I've never won a game.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: The winner gets to pick the movie we watch. I have won no games. So far I've seen "The Shining", "Rosemary's Baby", "The Ring". Not really my thing. Although, I... I do like the early parts of the movies where they have a perfect family and everything.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You want some help?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: K-a. "Ka"? What does "ka" mean?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It means you're playing someone who's going to destroy you. Why did you play "moo"?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Because I'm playing to win. I'm playing "moo", I'm playing "milk". Whatever it takes.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay, but look, you could have hit "mood". Would have played a...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: A triple word.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Like the cow mood yesterday. God.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Or moon.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: The cow jumped over the moon.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: She's stuck on that one thing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, it doesn't have to just be cow stuff, right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Kevin, Jim dropped out of my seminar, and I'm just... I was wondering if you could replace him as my charming warm up guy.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Andy, I'm no Jim. The only way that I'm Jim is in the movie version when Jim sees what his future would be like if he never met Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, that's crazy talk. I think you're great.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Then I won't let you down.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Cake.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: In you go.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hi, Ryan, you went to business school, right?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I need somebody to talk to this seminar about business.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: And?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Can you do it?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay. I don't... I don't like committing to things just like that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So no?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, I don't like committing to not doing things, either. That's just as big a commitment.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, baby.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What do I put you down for, bro hombre?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes, I'll do it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, than you so much. It's going to be so awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: And if I flake, I flake.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Kevin, you open it up.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ryan, you come in with your small biz expertise, right? And then Creed:

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Welcome everybody. Awesome to see you guys. My name is Andy Bernard but you can call me The Nard Dog.

Quote.Speaker: Older Woman
Quote.Text: Hi Nard Dog. I'm Lu Peachem.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let's get things started, shall we? You guys ready to hear from the Dunder Mifflin business experts? Good. Well, as you can see on your program... first up is a speech called, "Don't Just Dream it, do it." Yes! Please give a big hand to Mr. Kevin Malone. [plays Ozzy Osboure's Crazy Train]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [running laps around the conference room] Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: There are some people who have charm and some people who don't. Guess which type I am. Charm type.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [out of breath] Dream... big. Right? So what I want you to do is dream the biggest that you c... an. [coughing] And then double it! [coughing].

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you okay?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No. Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Here...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No. I'm fine. Okay, from here now. The first lesson that I'm gonna teach you, right, is about finding success. And the key to finding success is to picture a winner. [coughing] [vomiting]. Okay, so then, what are you picturing right now, right this second? 'Cause the universe is yours, people. Get out of the way! [runs out of room]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm really excited to introduce you guys to Ryan Howard. He has achieved a great deal in the last...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: But perhaps no achievement is greater than his on-again, off-again girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What are you...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Who am I? I'm Kelly Kapoor, the business bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It is important to brand yourself, so I have a couple of things in works. "The Business Bitch", "The Diet Bitch", "The Shopping Bitch", "The Etiquette Bitch."

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I could sit here, and I could tell you the ten secrets of business, and you would have a great time, and you would learn a lot. But who better to tell you than the Yale University adjunct professor in management, Professor Scott Powell, who I have on my Blackberry. It's ringing.

Quote.Speaker: Professor Powell
Quote.Text: Hey, Kelly Kapoor. What a delicious surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Profess Powell, you are on speakerphone.

Quote.Speaker: Professor Powell
Quote.Text: Uh, why?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Do you think you could tell us the ten secrets of business?

Quote.Speaker: Professor Powell
Quote.Text: Um, there aren't really ten secrets.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Come on Scott, please? It's me.

Quote.Speaker: Professor Powell
Quote.Text: Um, all right. Well, um, I guess know your market would be key. Practice fiscal discipline.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That brilliant little bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: A little treat for our old friend Gabe. Put that "q" right there.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Wait. Why?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Put the "q" there, sweetie.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think there's better...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Put the "q" there! [phone rings] Sorry I yelled.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You could have just told us what you were thinking.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: There's no theater in that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There's no yelling in that, either.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: What do you do in your free time?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [as Mikanos] Practice Olympics.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Mmm. Do you like movies?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [as Mikanos] I like the musical "Grease", or as we call it, "home".

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: We have to try this out on somebody.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [as Mikanos] Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Look, you want to order something?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She will have a greekaccino.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: I don't know what that is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [with accent] It's a very strong coffee with milk from a goat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] I can't believe-ee. It's a miracle. She can talk!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No more brain damage.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No more brain damage!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Ahh!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ladies and gentlemen, our special guest speaker will provoke you. He will inspire you. He is... Creed Bratton. [applause]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Two eyes, two ears, a chin, a mouth, ten fingers, two nipples. A butt, two kneecaps, a penis. I have just described to you the Loch Ness Monster. And the reward for its capture? All the riches in Scotland. So I have one question:

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I picked out our movie. It's called "Suspiria". It pushes all the boundaries. All your preconceived notions about what horror can be come crashing down.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: When I win...

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Ooh.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: We're gonna watch "Wall-e", where all the boundaries of color are pushed.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: It is hard to explain why Erin is doing so well today. The only thing I can think is Erin is living out some "Slumdog Millionaire" scenario, where every word she's playing has a connection to her orphan past. It's possible.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So what's your crazy business pipe dream?

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: Well, I started my own golf supply company.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [unimpressed] Really?

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: It's taken off faster than I expected, so I came here to learn about creating manageable growth.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [quietly] Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Some of these people are for real.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, friend. How's it going? Oh, you know what? Let me steep that for you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, you know what? Good news. We're back in. Let's go sell some paper, Buddy. Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Ahem!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I got it. I got it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [turning towards Darryl] Hey, do you need a lozenge?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [whispering] They're a bunch of jackals.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: They left you in the lurch, and if they want to jump in, it means you're almost there. You did this. Bring it home.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to Dwight, Stanley, and Phyllis]:

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hi. Hope you enjoyed your lunch. Welcome back. [to Michael and Holly] Ooh. Well, hello. Welcome to the seminar. Hey, man. What's goin' on?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispering] You're gonna blow it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Maybe. Only maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We got it! Wow! We got it!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oscar, wait. I think the victory would be more meaningful if Erin puts the last word in herself.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes, Pam. Yes, most definitely. Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [pulls phone back] Ah. No! [laughing] [hands phone back]. Although I must say, I will have "apoplexy" if you lose. Do you understand? "Apoplexy" is what I will have.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Apoplexy.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Got it. [plays word] Oh, Oscar. Oscar?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I played "ape."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] I just want to make a point to that last caller. I disagree. I don't think it is the running game at all. I think we do have to make a few moves in this off-season.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow! What a day, right? Guess you guys are probably ready to go. And you got my business card, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [as Mikanos] Dah, dah, dah, dah, dah. You know, I like you. I'm going to give you my secret gyro recipe. Come out here since it's a secret, and I'll tell you. [exits conference room] [normal voice] All, you have to close right now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I mean, I'm getting to it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you're not. You're getting past it. You have to close. You can do it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Andy, what's the problem?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is hard for me. I'm a nice guy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You, Kelly and Creed, Kevin, they believe in you. Don't let them down. Don't let yourself down, Andy. I'm gonna go back in. I'm going to stall them for a little bit. I want you to get your head together, and then come back in. I want you to close. [entering conference room] [as Mikanos] What is taking that guy so long?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Psst. You think this thing's gonna go much longer?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know. They're still in there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ohh! Good-bye.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Stop. Out with it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Here's the story. That guy in there is Jim's childhood friend, Tom.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Tom Witochkin. One of my best buddies, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And when they were both in the third grade, Jim was placed in the top reading group.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I was blue group, so it was second from the top.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And Tom...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Was in the green group.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And Jim's mom suggested that Jim spend time hanging with the kids in his reading group, because she though that would be a good influence.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And that's what I told him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Right. But how'd you say it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: "My mom thinks you're too dumb to hang out with."

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, who would like to purchase this small business package from me right now? Yes, we got one. Okay, the snowball is rolling. Who else? You can put it off for a couple of days, but I guarantee you, eventually you're gonna realize you need this. So the only thing that's gonna be different is you'll be a couple of days behind where you would be if you bought this from me right now. So who's gonna buy one right now?

Quote.Speaker: Older Woman
Quote.Text: I'll take one.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes! Awesome! All right, anyone else? [younger guy raises hand] Sold! Anybody else? [older guy raises hand] Yes! All right!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Good choice. The rest of you are dead to me. You made the stupidest decision of your life.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [quietly] No, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: But it was a pleasure meeting you, and you've got my information, so feel free to call anytime.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: Hey, you think it's cool if I grab a soda?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, woah. [deeper voice] Yep, absolutely, go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: How's it goin'?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: It's been a while.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It has been, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: So you work here, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sales.

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: Must be a front for some kind of famous laboratory. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: 'Cause you're so smart.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, man. You remember that, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: Oh, barely. I'm so dumb, you know, stuff goes in, stuff goes out. Not like you probably remember every paper sale you ever made. Paper salesman genius.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, good catch-up.

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: See ya.

Quote.Speaker: Tom
Quote.Text: Where's your jetpack, Zuckerberg?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Andy. I didn't think you had it in ya.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, I guess when you looked in me, you forgot about my balls. They're on the outside. Don't how you missed 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [with accent] Wonderful seminar!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [as Mikanos] Almost as good as the first day when we first met. You are the love of my life. Come to me, Necropolis. Put your lips on my lips. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Michael, I should get back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? Come on. It's time for grapes. [regular voice] Real fun day.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: So, I won.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I know. You get to pick.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Well, that's actually what I came to talk to you about. I know how much you want to watch "Wall-e".

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: So I got us a compromise. This movie's called "Hardware". It tells the story of a killer combat robot, just like Wall-e, that the government invented to destroy humans. It's some of what you like and some of what I like, and... married...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, I heard you talking about movies before, and, anyway, I just watched this over the weekend. I thought you'd really like it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: There's a "Shrek" two?!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. See you tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Nice guy.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ohh. [laughs]
